SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Forest glade bordering a dense evergreen schrubland composed of Pistacia terebinthus, Acer monspessulanum and Fraxinus ornus. The urban area of Sant Oreste is 500 m far.
Publication1: Unpublished data.
Publication2: Abbate G., Avena C. G., Blasi C., Zeri L., 1981.Studio delle tipologie fitosociologiche del monte Soratte (Lazio) e il loro contributo nella definizione fitogeografica dei complessi vegetazionali centro appenninici. CNR, Roma.
Worker1_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma

SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Mixed woodland dominated by Quercus ilex, but rich deciduous trees such as Acer monspessulanum, Acer campestre, Fraxinus ornus, Ostrya carpinifolia, and Sorbus torminalis.
Publication1: Unpublished data.
Publication2: Abbate G., Avena C. G., Blasi C., Zeri L., 1981.Studio delle tipologie fitosociologiche del monte Soratte (Lazio) e il loro contributo nella definizione fitogeografica dei complessi vegetazionali centro appenninici. CNR, Roma.
Worker1_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma

SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Quercus ilex forest with very few occurrences of Acer monspessulanum and Fraxinus ornus. The understory layer is mostly composed of Cyclamen spp., Smylax aspera and Anemone apennina.
Publication1: Unpublished data.
Publication2: Abbate G., Avena C. G., Blasi C., Zeri L., 1981.Studio delle tipologie fitosociologiche del monte Soratte (Lazio) e il loro contributo nella definizione fitogeografica dei complessi vegetazionali centro appenninici. CNR, Roma.

SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Forest glade within a semi-open forest, characterized by evergreen and deciduous species, notably Quercus ilex, Phillyrea latifolia, Pistacia terebinthus, Acer monspessulanum and Fraxinus ornus. The urban area of Sant Oreste is 500 m far.
Publication1: Unpublished data.
Publication2: Abbate G., Avena C. G., Blasi C., Zeri L., 1981.Studio delle tipologie fitosociologiche del monte Soratte (Lazio) e il loro contributo nella definizione fitogeografica dei complessi vegetazionali centro appenninici. CNR, Roma.

SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Olive orchards with communities of deciduous Quercus, within arable land planted with Brassica napus and cereals.
Publication1: Unpublished data.

SiteDescription: Monte Soratte is a 690 m high isolated limestone relief 35 km from the centre of Rome
VegDescription: Woodland characterized by mixed deciduous oaks mostly represented by Quercus cerris, Carpinus and Rosaceae. The understory is composed of Ruscus aculeatus, Cyclamen spp. and Anemone apennina.
Publication1: Unpublished data.

SiteDescription: Coastal area lying on the former Salpi Lagoon in Apulia region
VegDescription: The present landscape of the site is characterized by arable lands mostly cultivated with cereals. This treeless area presents widespread arid pastures rich in Ferula communis, Scolymus hispanicus, Asphodelus spp. and Plantago spp. Sparse olive orchards are present not far from the site. The original lagoonal environment and its brackish vegetation, mostly represented by the genera Salicornia, Sarcocornia, and Salsola of the Amaranthaceae family, are preserved in the close protected wetland of Palude Frattarolo.
Publication1: Di Rita, F., Simone, O., Caldara, M., Gehrels, W.R., Magri, D., 2011. Holocene environmental changes in the coastal Tavoliere Plain (Apulia, southern Italy): a multiproxy approach. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 310, 139–151.
Worker1_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma
Worker2_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma

SiteDescription: Tectonic lake close to the easternmost coast of Italian Peninsula
VegDescription: The present vegetation of the area is highly degraded, and the natural evergreen arboreal cover is very limited. The landscape is now characterized by olive groves, cultivated land and stands of planted Pinus halepensis. In the residual patches of maquis the dominant species is Quercus coccifera, mostly accompanied by Olea europaea var. sylvestris, Pistacia lentiscus, Phillyrea latifolia, Arbutus unedo, Erica manipuliflora, Rhamnus alaternus, Myrtus communis, Ceratonia siliqua, and Calycotome spinosa. The shore of Lago Alimini Piccolo is occupied by lush reeds dominated by Phragmites australis. Lago Alimini Grande presents an abundant halophilic flora, with several species of Plantago and Limonium along its shore.
Publication1: Di Rita, F., Magri, D., 2009. Holocene drought, deforestation, and evergreen vegetation development in the central Mediterranean: a 5,500 year record from Lago Alimini Piccolo, Apulia, southeast Italy. The Holocene 19, 295–306
Worker1_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma
Worker2_Address1: Dipartimento di Biologia Ambientale, Universita La Sapienza, Piazzale Aldo Moro, 5, 00185 Roma

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank
VegDescription: Fescue–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover 60%; on bare spots, up to 80–90% siltstone fragments). Festuca lenensis Drobow, Poa attenuata Trin., Carex pediformis C.A. Mey, Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan., Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Veron ica incana L., Eremogone tschuktschorum (Regel) Ikonn., Dianthus versicolor Fisch. ex Link., Galium verum L., Pulsatilla multifida (Pritz.) Juz., Potentilla nivea L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank (southern slope, up to 45°), opposite the Ambolikha River inflow
VegDescription: Grass–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover 50%) on a mobile sediment. Plants form pillows or small tussocks retaining the sediment. Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan., Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Eremogone tschuktschorum (Regel) Ikonn., Dianthus versicolor Fisch. ex Link., Festuca lenensis Drobow, Calamagrostis purpurascens R. Br., Pulsatilla multifida (Pritz.) Juz., Potentilla nivea L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Duvanny Yar exposure, Kolyma River right bedrock bank
VegDescription: Dwarf birch–larch forest. Larix cajanderi Mayr., Betula exilis Sukacz., Salix glauca L., Ledum palustre (Ait.) Lodd. ex Steud., Rosa acicularis Lindl., Vaccinium uliginosum L., V. minus (Lodd.) Worosch., Empetrum nigrum L., Rubus chamaemorus L. Tomentipnum nitens (Hedw.) Loeske, Sphagnum magellanicum, Peltigera aptosa (L.) Willd., Dactylina arctica (Hock.) Nyl., Cladonia rangiferina (L.) F.H. Wigg., C. alpestris (L.) Nyl., C. pyxidata (L.) Hoffm.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank (southern slope, up to 60°), opposite the Ambolikha River inflow
VegDescription: Grass–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover up to 60–70%), with bare sediment spots. Plants form tussocks retaining the sediment. Veronica incana L., Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan, Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Festuca lenensis Drobow, Calamagrostis purpurascens R. Br., Artemisia dracunculus L., Potentilla nivea L., Silene stenophylla Ledeb., Allium strictum Schrad., Chamaenerion angustifolium (L.) Scop. The outlier is edged by a larch forest composed of Larix cajanderi Mayr., with undergrowth of Betula divaricata Ledeb., Salix glauca L., Vaccinium vitisidaea L., V. uliginosum L., Rosa acicularis Lindl., and Ledum palustre L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank
VegDescription: Dwarf birch–larch forest. Larix cajanderi Mayr., Betula divaricata Ledeb., Salix glauca L., S. pulchra Cham., Ledum decumbens (Ait.) Lodd. ex Steud., Vaccinium uliginosum L., V. vitisidaea L., Arctous alpina (L.) Spreng., Empetrum nigrum L., E. androgynum V.N. Vassil., Rosa acicularis Lindl., Arctagrostis latifolia R. Br., Equisetum arvense L.; mosses: Aulacomnium turgidum (Wahlenb.) Schwaegr., Dicranum sp.; lichens: Cladonia rangiferina (L.) Harm., Peltigera aphtosa (L.) Willd.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

Betula exilis Sukacz., B. nana L., Vaccinium vitisidaea L., V. uliginosum L., Empetrum nigrum L., E. androgynum V.N. Vassil., Alopecurus alpinus Smith, Carex concolor R. Gray, Saxifraga hieracifolia Waldst. et Kit., Juncus castaneus Smith, Draba cinerea Adams, Ranunculus gmelinii DC, Festuca   brachyphylla Schult. et Schult.; lichens: Peltigera aphthosa (L.)
